page.title: 04ATTITUDES
page.content:
The main concern of the young people of Akeley is the fear that the County Council will consider the village school too small and close it. Thus putting another nail in the coffin of their village: the church has gone, no shops and a very run down village hall - inadequate bus service. Ahead, the fear of unemployment and nuclear war, come in that order. Most people are mainly concerned with family wel- fare, their lonliness, perhaps how to pay their bills, but they delight in the beautiful area in which they live. On a fine sunny day, it's hard to visualise a nuclear wasteland when you can see the grass grows, no matter what.
